result.execSummary:
The defendant Davonci S Hennings was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery with Use of Force [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(a).
  • 2nd Degree Reckless Injury [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.23(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges as to both counts. 
**AS TOR RESTITUTION/ALL FINANCIAL OBLIGATIONS:  DOC to collect  monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds.  Balance as a condition of Extended Supervision, to be paid by end of sentence or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.

superMiscConds.notes:
No violations of criminal law rising to the level of probable cause. No contact with Kyle S.
Not to have contact with Kyle S. during the entire length of the sentence. Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a biological speciment for DNA analysis.
Court advised defendant he cannot possess firearms and of the additonal penalties pursuant to 941.29(4m)(a) and 941.29(1g);  he cannot possess body armor; he must provide a DNA  sample  and cannot vote until his civil rights  restored.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to count one.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Davonci S Hennings

records.addlTxt: Per order dated May 1, 2020, Appeal No. 2020XX645-CR, IT IS ORDERED that the request for release from prison is denied.

Per Remittitur dated February 12, 2019, Appeal No. 2016AP001562 CRNM, IT IS ORDERED AND ADJUDGED by this court in a decision filed on September 19, 2018, that:  IT IS ORDERED that the judgment is summarily affirmed.  See Wis. Stat. Rule 809.21.  IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Attorney Carly M. Cusack is relieved of further representation of Hennings in this matter.  See Wis. Stat. Rule 809.32(3).
records.descr: Remittitur/Court of Appeals dec & order affirming

records.addlTxt: per order dated February 12, 2019, Appeal No.  2016AP1562-CRNM, IT IS ORDERED that the petition for review is denied, without costs.
Acknowledgment of receipt of the Petition for Review by the Supreme Court.

Per order dated Setember 19, 2018, Appeal No. 2016AP1562-CRNM, IT IS ORDERED that the judgment is summarily affirmed.  See Wis. Stat. Rule 809.21.  IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Attorney Carly M. Cusack  is relieved from further representing Hennings in this matter.  See Wis. Stat. Rule 809.32(3).  IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that this summary disposition order will not be published.
records.descr: Court of Appeals decision & order affirming

records.addlTxt: per order dated January 24, 2018, Appeal No. 2016AP1562-CRNM, IT IS ORDERED that Attorney Auberry's response is accepted as filed. IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Attorney Cusack's motion to withdraw as counsel is denied at this time.
Letter from Atty. Ann Auberry notifying the court she will not be representing defendant on postconviction or appellate issues, received and filed.

per order dated January 12, 2018, Appeal No. 2016AP1562, IT IS ORDERED that Hennings' response is not accepted as filed because it is unsigned. IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Attorney Ann R. Auberry shall file a notice of appearance and a status report, as described herein, by February 1, 2018.

Per Order Dated December 12, 2017, Appeal No. 2016AP1562-CRNM, IT IS ORDERED that the motion to withdraw as counsel is held in abeyance pending further order of this court. IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that within thirty days of the date of this order, Hennings shall write a letter to the court in the manner described in this order stating whether he wishes to discharge Attorney Cusack and whether he wishes to proceed pro se. If Hennings does not respond, or if response is insufficient, Attorney Cusack shall continue as appointed appellate counsel for Hennings.

records.addlTxt: Appeal rights given.  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Pretrial Incarceration Credit and Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgment received and filed.  Copies given to the defendant.

Defendant Davonci S Hennings in court with attorney Richard E. Poulson.  Defendant Davonci S Hennings in custody.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Sentencing proceeds.  No corrections made to the PSI report.  State has complied with victim notification.  Statements by counsel, Teasia P. and defendant.  

COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms and of the additional penalties pursuant to 941.29(4m)(a) and 941.29(1g); he cannot possess body armor; he must provide a DNA sample and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  

Count 1:  COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE - 10 years with 339 days credit; INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT - 5 years; EXTENDED SUPERVISION - 5 years; pay mandatory costs, assessments  and surcharges by the end of the sentence or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.

Count 2:  COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE - 10 years; INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT - 5 years; EXTENDED SUPERVISION - 5  years - consecutive to Count 1; pay mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges by the end of the sentence or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.

Court finds defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  1) no violations of criminal law rising to the level of probable cause; 2) pay any monetary amounts ordered but not paid while in the institution; 3) obtain GED; 4) No contact with Kyle S.

COURT ORDERS:
- pay restitution of $1,025 to Kyle S. by the end of the sentence or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant;
- DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds;
- defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis
- defendant to have no contact with Kyle S. during the entire length of the sentence.  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Check request X262145 Forwarded to Accounts Payable in the amount of $72.00 paid to PARK EAST HOTEL for witness Kyle R Shufelt, appearance in court 10/26, 10/27 of 2015 copy in file.
Crime Victim Impact Statement and Restitution Worksheet received and filed./ds
Jury in the box at 9:04 a.m.

Defendant Davonci S Hennings in court with attorney Richard E. Poulson.  Defendant Davonci S Hennings in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant still wishes to change his plea to guilty in this case.  Court continues with the plea colloquy from the previous day.  State's witness from Clintonville is present in court today. 

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY to the amended counts 1 & 2 and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty to Counts 1 & 2 as charged in the Amended Information and enters a judgment of conviction.

Factual Basis for Court's Acceptance of Guilty/No Contest Plea received and filed.

Parties advised the Court will listen to statements by counsel, victim, a friend or relative of the defendant and defendant.  Any other statements must be in writing and provided to the Court 72 hours in advance of sentencing.

Court orders a presentence investigation.  On motion of the State, the defendant is sworn-in for testimony to assist in the investigation.  Sworn-in for the State: Davonci Hennings.  Court orders defendant remanded into the custody of the sheriff pending sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY to amended Counts 1 & 2 and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  

During the plea colloquy with the Court, the defendant states he was "just there.  I didn't do anything."   Court DOES NOT accept the defendant's guilty plea and will proceed with the jury trial on Oct. 27th.

Defendant Davonci S Hennings in court with attorney Richard E. Poulson.  Defendant Davonci S Hennings in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Amended Information received and filed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of a copy of the Amended Information and waives reading.  Court AMENDS the charges to Count 1) Robbery (Use of Force) PTAC 943.32(1)(a), 939.05 a Class E Felony and Count 2) Second Degree Reckless Injury PTAC 940.23(2)(a), 939.05 a Class F Felony.  On motion of the State, Court further amends the Amended Information and DISMISSES the penalty enhancer of "While Armed."

Parties are prepared to proceed to jury trial.  Parties impanel a jury of 12 good and lawful citizens of Milwaukee County.  Voire Dire:  3:00 p.m.  Jury list received, filed and sealed.  Jury out of the box at 3:50 p.m.  Jury in the box at 4:08 p.m.  Jury sworn-in. Court gives the jury preliminary instructions.  Court adjourns case to 10-27-15 at 8:30 a.m.  Jury out of the box at 4:30 p.m.  

Parties hand a note to the Court stating the defendant now wishes to changes his plea.

Defendant Davonci S Hennings in court with attorney Richard E. Poulson.  Defendant Davonci S Hennings in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Case transferred forthwith to Br. 44 for jury trial.  The State's witness is with the State's investigator in Clintonville and will be here by the end of the day.  Court rules on defense's motions in limine.  Court orders witnesses sequestered.  Parties stipulate to defendant and witnesses' prior record.

Defendant Davonci S Hennings in court with attorney Richard E. Poulson.  Defendant Davonci S Hennings in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for further proceedings. State advised court that the material witness will be produced and warrant is no longer needed. Court will not issue the body attachment warrant previously requested by the state. Branch 25 has another speedy jury trial scheduled for today. Branch 44 agreed to hear this matter for Branch 25. Parties notified. Case adjourned to Branch 44.

Attorney Richard E. Poulson in court, defendant Davonci S Hennings not in court, in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for jury trial. State requests for an adjournment because the witness is unavailable for today's proceedings. State requests a body attachment warrant be issued on the witness. Defense does not object. Court will issue body attachment warrant by 9:30 a.m. if witness is not produced. Case will be re-called at 10:30 a.m.
Proposed Verdict forms received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
State's Requested Jury Instructions with attached substantive instructions received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Davonci S Hennings in court with attorney Richard E. Poulson.  Defendant Davonci S Hennings in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for final pretrial. Parties are still in negotiations. State to file jury instructions, motions in limine, proposed verdict forms and substantive jury instructions by 10/02/15. State placed offer on the record. Parties to advise the Court if a resolution is reached prior to the jury trial date. Case remains scheduled for jury trial on 10/26/15. Case adjourned to Branch 25.
State's Witness List received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Defense Motion in Limine received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Defendant's Requested Jury Instructions received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Defendant's Witness List received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
NOTICE OF MOTION AND MOTION TO MODIFY BOND, FILED

Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.  

Parties to file motions by 08/17/2015.  Any response is due 09/08/2015. Any reply is due 09/14/2015. Any motions requiring testimony will be heard on the final pretrial date. Parties to file witness lists, jury instructions, and motions in limine by one week before the final pretrial date. State to file proposed verdict forms and substantive jury instructions by the final pretrial date.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Cimpl (post-rotation).  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Rothstein, Br. 25.

Attorney Richard E. Poulson in court, defendant Davonci S Hennings not in court, in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for schedunling conference. Motion to amend bail received and filed. Arguments heard.  Court denied the defense motion.  All terms and conditions of bail remain the same.   All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Dennis Cimpl, Branch 19, in Room 313 of the Safety Building due to rotation. Defense requests a substitution. Case adjourned.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 26, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Richard E. Poulson in court, defendant Davonci S Hennings not in court, in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for status of counsel.  Defense requests more time to review case.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Davonci S Hennings not in court, defendant in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for status of counsel.  Former defense attorney did not notify the public defender's office that new counsel needed to be appointed.  Case adjourned for status of counsel in Branch 22.  Status conference scheduled for June 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Davonci S Hennings in court with attorney Thomas J. Flanagan.  Defendant Davonci S Hennings in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for final pre-trial, however   Attorney Flanagan informs court that he has not received payment.  Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court.  Attorney is to inform the Public Defender's Office that new counsel needs to be appointed.  Case is adjourned for status of counsel in Branch 22.
Jury trial date of 06/29/2015 is ordered vacated.  Status conference scheduled for June 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Thomas J. Flanagan in court, defendant Davonci S Hennings not in court, in custody.  Irene Parthum for Thomas Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for Pre-trial conference, defense requests final pre-trial and jury trial dates.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for June 29, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Case scheduled for pretrial conference on 03-03-2015 at 1:30 pm.  Defense counsel did not appear, defendant was in custody.  Case adjourned for another pretrial conference on 03-12-2015 at 8:30 am.  Attorney Flanagan and ADA Potter notified.

Attorney Thomas J. Flanagan in court, defendant Davonci S Hennings not in court, in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
For reasons stated on the record, the Court DENIES the defense motion for bail reduction.  Defense requests more time to review case.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 3, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Davonci S Hennings in court with attorney Thomas J. Flanagan.  Defendant Davonci S Hennings in custody.  Randy Sitzberger for Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for January 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for January 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.


**Defense to address bail on the next date.**
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Kyle S.; Courtney H. or Tyler C.

Defendant Davonci S Hennings in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Davonci S Hennings in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
